page.title: 16The Churches
page.content: Both of the churches are very old, dating from Saxon times, before the Norman Conquest. The Church of the Holy Rood, Daglingworth, has 3 Late Saxon limestone sculptures set in the interior walls, the most remarkable one being a plaque with a picture of the Crucifixion. Outside the church a Saxon Crucifix and Sundial can be seen. Many tourists visit this interesting church which can seat about l4O. Services are held here every Sunday. The Church of St. Michael is a tiny Saxon church with l7th Century panelled bow pews for about 45 people. It has a saddle-back tower and crypt below the chancel. Family services in which children take part are held here once a month.
